body.p: Alexandria, Kentucky, attorney. Campbell County, Kentucky, native. Son of Samuel Baker and Elizabeth Armstrong Baker. Married to Sarah B. Bell Baker in 1841. Married to Mary Jane Orr Baker in 1853. Father of William B. Baker, Sarah B. Baker, and Courtland T. Baker. Deputy sheriff of Campbell County from 1838 to 1841. Independently studied law from 1841 to 1842. Graduated from the Cincinnati Law School in 1843. Employed by the Clerk of the Campbell County Court from 1843 to 1844. Opened legal practice in 1844 in Alexandria. County attorney in Campbell County from 1846 to 1848. Member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from Campbell County in 1849. Member of the Senate of the Commonwealth of Kentucky in Campbell County and Pendleton County, Kentucky, from 1861 to 1869. Unsuccessful candidate for governor in 1863.
